rules: The General Preamble provides details about billing requirements for all physicians.
Definitions of key terms and phrases are italicized for cross-reference.
Services rendered on a holiday are eligible for payment only if listed as a holiday premium or service.
notes: The Schedule lists services insured by OHIP and includes various sections applicable to all specialties.
The information provided in the General Information Section is foundational for the remainder of the General Preamble.

fee_codes.description: Special family and general practice consultation
fee_codes.conditions: Exclusive of time spent rendering any other separately billable intervention.

fee_codes.description: Comprehensive family and general practice consultation
fee_codes.conditions: Start and stop times must be recorded in the patient’s permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Comprehensive family and general practice consultation
fee_codes.conditions: Start and stop times must be recorded in the patient’s permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Special palliative care consultation
fee_codes.conditions: Start and stop times must be recorded in the patient’s permanent medical record.

fee_codes.description: Limited consultation
Repeat consultation
General assessment
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment for an assessment provided in the patient’s home.

fee_codes.description: General re-assessment
Minor assessment
Intermediate assessment or well baby care
fee_codes.conditions: Special visit premiums are not eligible for payment when rendered in a patient’s home.

fee_codes.description: Enhanced 18 month well baby visit
Mini assessment
fee_codes.conditions: Only payable when the WSIB component of the visit is A001.

fee_codes.description: Periodic health visit for child
Periodic health visit for adolescent
Periodic health visit for adult age 18 to 64 inclusive
Periodic health visit for adult 65 years of age and older
Emergency department equivalent - partial assessment
fee_codes.conditions: No premiums are payable for a service rendered in an emergency department equivalent.

rules: Start and stop times must be recorded for certain consultations.
No other consultation, assessment, visit or counselling service is eligible for payment when rendered the same day as A911 or A912.
notes: Electrocardiography and pulmonary function test services are not payable when rendered to a patient who does not have symptoms.

fee_codes.description: peripheral and superior vena cava
without blood pool images
with blood pool images
first pass for shunt detection, cardiac output and transit studies
resting, immediate post stress
application of SPECT (maximum 1 per examination), to J807
application of Rubidium PET for cardiac perfusion (maximum 1 per examination), to J807
delayed
application of SPECT (maximum 2 per examination), to J808
application of Rubidium PET for cardiac perfusion (maximum 1 per examination), to J808
fee_codes.conditions: only eligible for payment in patients with known coronary artery disease or suspected coronary artery disease at intermediate risk (10-90%)

rules: Professional and technical components are claimed separately.
Claims for the technical component H are submitted using listed fee code with suffix B.
Claims for professional component are submitted using listed fee code with suffix C.
notes: Costs for the technical component of services rendered in an ICHSC are listed in the Schedule of Facility Costs.

The technical and professional fee components for myocardial perfusion imaging / echocardiogram / exercise stress test / stress echocardiogram are not eligible for payment in the routine preoperative preparation or screening of a patient for surgery where the patient will undergo a low risk procedure or has a low risk of perioperative cardiac complications, unless there is a clinical indication.

fee_codes.description: Pharynx and oesophagus - cine or videotape
fee_codes.conditions: Should not be claimed routinely with X108 and X109 but only when specifically indicated.

fee_codes.description: Oesophagus, stomach and duodenum - double contrast
fee_codes.conditions: Presupposes the introduction of gas, the use of antifoam agent and a suitable barium mixture.

fee_codes.description: Oesophagus, stomach and duodenum - single contrast
Lumbar or lumbosacral spine
fee_codes.conditions: Does not include the entire sacrum. An x-ray of the sacrum may be carried out and claimed for only when specifically indicated.

rules: Professional and technical components are claimed separately.
Claims for technical component H are submitted using the listed fee code with suffix B.
Claims for professional component P are submitted using the listed fee code with suffix C.
For services rendered outside a hospital setting, the only fees billable under the Health Insurance Act are listed under the column P (use suffix C).
notes: Diagnostic Radiology procedures are divided into a professional component listed in the column headed with a 'P', and a technical component listed in the column headed with an 'H'.

The technical component of the procedures subject to the conditions stated under 'Diagnostic Services Rendered at a Hospital' is eligible for payment only if the service is rendered at a hospital or an off-site premise operated by a hospital corporation.

sections.section_title: Clinical Procedures associated with Diagnostic Radiological Examinations

fee_codes.description: insertion of catheter (including cut down, if necessary) and injection, if given
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment in addition to cardiac catheterization procedures (Z439 to G288).

fee_codes.description: selective catheterization - add to catheter insertion fee (per vessel, to maximum of 4)
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment in addition to cardiac catheterization procedures (Z439 to G288).

fee_codes.description: selective catheterization for spinal and parathyroid angiography
transcatheter fibrinolytic therapy
Vascular stenting
fee_codes.conditions: Claimed same patient same day as G298 is payable at nil.

fee_codes.description: Renal angioplasty
direct puncture
Transluminal angioplasty including angiography (if anatomy is known), with or without pressure measurements - one or more site(s) or vessel(s)
fee_codes.conditions: If anatomy unknown at time of procedure, claim J021 and/or J022 at 50%. For simultaneous bilateral punctures and angioplasties, the amount payable for the second angioplasty is reduced by 50%. J021 & J022 may not be claimed with J025 if anatomy is known.

bilateral bronchial brushing
unilateral bronchogram
bilateral bronchogram

bilateral bronchogram with intra-tracheal catheter

Cavernosography

one disc discogram

Embolization of spinal arteriovenous malformation

Laryngogram

rules: Radiological services may be claimed in addition. See Diagnostic Radiology for the appropriate fees.
notes: For cardiac catheterization procedures, see the Diagnostic and Therapeutic Procedures section of the Schedule.

multislice sequence

rules: MRI studies of the lumbar spine should not be routinely ordered or rendered for low back pain without suspected or known pathology.
notes: Breast MRI is not an insured service for routine screening of an average risk individual.

quantitative, A-mode
B-scan immersion
B-scan contact
biometry (Axial length - A-mode)
excluding vascular study
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment when rendered for ultrasound imaging of the sinus(es).

complete

for high risk pregnancy or complications of pregnancy
fetal Doppler evaluation of middle cerebral artery and/or ductus venosus, to J160 or J158
fee_codes.conditions: Only eligible for payment when rendered by a physician for assessment of fetal anemia, intrauterine growth retardation, or in high-risk pregnancies.

fee_codes.description: nuchal translucency for Prenatal Genetic Screening (maximum one per pregnancy)
fee_codes.conditions: Ultrasound services listed under the headings 'Abdomen and Retroperitoneum' or 'Pelvis' or 'Pregnancy' rendered on the same day to the same patient by any physician as J168 are not eligible for payment.

fee_codes.description: multiple gestation, for each additional fetus, to J168.

rules: Professional and technical components are claimed separately.
Claims for the technical component H are submitted using listed fee code with suffix B.
Claims for professional component are submitted using listed fee code with suffix C.
For services rendered outside a hospital setting the only fees billable under the Health Insurance Act are listed under the column P (use suffix C).
Costs for the technical component of these services are only billable under the Integrated Community Health Services Centres Act, 2023.
notes: Ultrasound services are not insured when rendered to support in-vitro fertilization services or artificial insemination services.

fee_codes.description: Volume versus Time Study - must include Vital capacity, FEV1, FEV1/FVC, and may include calculation of MMEFR(FEF25-75)
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment same patient same day as J304 or J327. Must represent the best of three recorded test results.

fee_codes.description: Repeat after bronchodilator
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment same patient same day as J304 or J327. Must represent the best of three recorded test results.

fee_codes.description: Volume versus Flow Study - from which an expiratory limb, and inspiratory limb if indicated, are generated.
fee_codes.conditions: Must represent the best of three recorded test results. Must include a permanent record with a written interpretation by the physician.

fee_codes.description: Repeat after bronchodilator
fee_codes.conditions: Must represent the best of three recorded test results. Must include a permanent record with a written interpretation by the physician.

fee_codes.description: By gas dilution method
fee_codes.conditions: Not to be claimed same patient same day as J307.

fee_codes.description: By body plethysmography
fee_codes.conditions: Not to be claimed same patient same day as J311.

fee_codes.description: Lung compliance (pressure volume curve of the lung from TLC to FRC)
Airways resistance by plethysmography or estimated using oesophageal catheter
Extra pulmonary airways resistance by plethysmography
Maximum inspiratory and expiratory pressures
Carbon monoxide diffusing capacity by single breath method
Carbon dioxide ventilatory response
Graded exercise to maximum tolerance (exercise must include continuous heart rate, oximetry and ventilation monitoring)

rules: Professional and technical components are claimed separately.
Claims for technical component H are submitted using listed fee code with suffix B.
Claims for professional component P are submitted using listed fee code with suffix C.
For services rendered outside a hospital setting, the only fees billable under the Health Insurance Act are listed under the column P (use suffix C).
Each of the following tests designated by an individual code number is considered to be specific and requires individual ordering.
Exercise assessment requires a physician to be in attendance at all times.

The technical and professional fee components for pulmonary function studies are not eligible for payment in the routine preoperative preparation or screening of a patient for non-thoracic surgery unless required for respiratory diagnosis, anesthetic decision making or optimization of a patient's respiratory disease prior to surgery.

fee_codes.description: Basic fee-per-visit premium for procedures marked (+)
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment for a service provided in a hospital. Not eligible for payment when the service marked with (+) is not eligible for payment.

rules: Services listed in the Diagnostic and Therapeutic Procedures Section are eligible for payment in addition to a consultation or assessment except where they are specifically listed as included in consultation or assessment services.
When a procedure(s) is the sole reason for a visit, add G700 for those procedures marked (+) regardless of the number of procedures carried out during that visit.
notes: If a patient presents for an allergy injection and has an acute infectious condition, the physician is entitled to claim the appropriate assessment fee as well as the injection fee.
If a patient requires a brief assessment of his allergic condition as well as the allergy injection, the physician should claim the injection and the basic fee.

fee_codes.description: Postnatal care in hospital/home - initial assessment of a well patient postpartum with subsequent assessments until the patient’s first visit to the physician’s office.
fee_codes.conditions: Specific elements for each visit are those for assessments.

fee_codes.description: Attendance at maternal delivery.
fee_codes.conditions: Included in the labour-delivery fee.

fee_codes.description: Attendance at maternal delivery for newborn care.
fee_codes.conditions: Claimed if service is provided.

fee_codes.description: Assisted breech delivery including spontaneous delivery to the umbilicus, with extraction of the shoulders, arms and head.

rules: Obstetrical services have specific elements as listed in the Schedule.
Attendance at labour and delivery may not be claimed when a patient is transferred to a second physician for normal obstetrical care.
Medical induction or stimulation of labour may be claimed once per pregnancy by any one physician.
notes: Normal prenatal care includes monthly visits to 28 weeks, followed by visits every 2nd week to 36 weeks, then weekly visits until delivery.
Illnesses associated with pregnancy requiring added visits shall be claimed on a per visit basis.
